docs.abstract: As investors continue to seek respectable returns in the safety of government bonds, major stock indexes look set to decline for another day.
docs.snippet: As investors continue to seek respectable returns in the safety of government bonds, major stock indexes look set to decline for another day.
docs.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

headline.main: Stocks Appear Set to Fall Further as Bond Yields Stay High

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: With the prepaid cards, parents don’t need to have cash on hand. Promoters say the cards give parents digital oversight of their children’s spending.
docs.snippet: With the prepaid cards, parents don’t need to have cash on hand. Promoters say the cards give parents digital oversight of their children’s spending.
docs.lead_paragraph: No need to worry about coming up with cash for a child’s allowance. Parents can now choose from a rapidly expanding menu of prepaid debit cards, aimed at giving them digital oversight of their children’s spending and saving habits.

headline.main: Children’s Allowances in a New Form: Debit Cards Linked to Parents’ Phones
headline.print_headline: Dishes Done? Leaves Raked? Here’s a Paperless Allowance

docs.abstract: Frequent travelers who were in Starwood’s program — and Marriott customers, too — were used to being pampered. Now, they’re complaining of hours on the phone.
docs.snippet: Frequent travelers who were in Starwood’s program — and Marriott customers, too — were used to being pampered. Now, they’re complaining of hours on the phone.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ben Greenstein didn’t expect to spend more than four hours on the phone over three days just to redeem points for a hotel booking in Boston.

headline.main: Marriott’s Merger of Hotel Rewards Programs Tests Members’ Loyalty
headline.print_headline: Travelers Used to Pampering Adjust to Holding for the Next Agent

docs.abstract: In an interview with CNBC, the president said he was “not thrilled” about recent interest rate increases, upending longstanding protocol to avoid comments on monetary policy.
docs.snippet: In an interview with CNBC, the president said he was “not thrilled” about recent interest rate increases, upending longstanding protocol to avoid comments on monetary policy.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump criticized the Federal Reserve on Thursday for raising interest rates, a rare rebuke by a sitting president that upends longstanding White House protocol to avoid commenting on monetary policy.

headline.main: Trump Takes a Rare Presidential Swipe at the Fed
headline.print_headline: Upending Protocol, Trump Swipes at Fed Over Interest Rate Increases

docs.abstract: Public funds are flexing their financial might with private equity on issues from severance for Toys “R” Us workers to workplace harassment.
docs.snippet: Public funds are flexing their financial might with private equity on issues from severance for Toys “R” Us workers to workplace harassment.
docs.lead_paragraph: Private equity firms and public pension funds have long had a symbiotic relationship: The funds supply the firms with billions of dollars to invest, and the firms deliver double-digit returns that help the funds support retired public servants.

headline.main: Pensions Get Bolder in Challenging Private Equity on Investments’ Human Cost
headline.print_headline: Pensions Flex More Muscle To Put Shield On Workers

docs.abstract: At a time when trust in its services is eroding, the social network introduced Portal and Portal Plus, its first major effort to build consumer hardware from scratch.
docs.snippet: At a time when trust in its services is eroding, the social network introduced Portal and Portal Plus, its first major effort to build consumer hardware from scratch.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Since 2004, Facebook has said it wants to bring the world closer together. To accomplish that goal, the company has relied mostly on the web and smartphone apps.

headline.main: Facebook’s New Gadget Is a Video-Chat Screen With a Camera That Follows You
headline.print_headline: Facebook’s New Gadget Is a Video-Chat Screen Whose Camera Follows You

byline.original: By Mike Isaac and Brian X. Chen

docs.abstract: Google’s overhaul for the web may not be everyone’s cup of tea, but you can return to the previous version for a while longer.
docs.snippet: Google’s overhaul for the web may not be everyone’s cup of tea, but you can return to the previous version for a while longer.
docs.lead_paragraph: UPDATE: Google has transitioned Gmail accounts to the updated version that it released last spring, and is now removing the option to go back to the “classic Gmail.” (The stripped-down HTML view is still available for some browsers but lacks many  features).

headline.main: How to Go Back to the Old Gmail

docs.abstract: As President Trump intensifies trade hostilities, the potential for conflict has begun to disrupt business, sowing worries about global economic growth.
docs.snippet: As President Trump intensifies trade hostilities, the potential for conflict has begun to disrupt business, sowing worries about global economic growth.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Only a few months ago, the global economy appeared to be humming, with all major nations growing in unison. Now, the world’s fortunes are imperiled by an unfolding trade war.

headline.main: Just the Fear of a Trade War Is Straining the Global Economy
headline.print_headline: Trade War Fears Start to Strain Global Economy

byline.original: By Peter S. Goodman, Ian Austen and Elisabeth Malkin

docs.abstract: The Federal Reserve released minutes of its last meeting that suggest it is on track to continue raising rates, perhaps to a level that would act as a mild brake on the economy.
docs.snippet: The Federal Reserve released minutes of its last meeting that suggest it is on track to continue raising rates, perhaps to a level that would act as a mild brake on the economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve’s official account of its latest policy meeting, published Wednesday, does not mention any discussion of President Trump’s demands that the Fed should stop raising interest rates.

headline.main: Fed Plans to Continue Raising Rates, Despite Trump’s Ire
headline.print_headline: Despite Trump’s Anger, Fed Plans to Continue On Path to Raise Rates

docs.abstract: Their numbers remain small, but more women are being trained for the jobs that determine how our cars look and feel.
docs.snippet: Their numbers remain small, but more women are being trained for the jobs that determine how our cars look and feel.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thirteen years ago, Sharon Gauci became the first woman asked to join the judges’ panel for her native country’s Australian Design Awards. The annual laurels had been handed out since the 1950s, so Ms. Gauci may be forgiven if she viewed the invitation — a career highlight — as a smidge overdue.

headline.main: Women Get Feet in the Door of the Car Design Boys’ Club
headline.print_headline: Future for Women in Shaping Cars of Tomorrow

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: ACURA DIVISION OF HONDA MOTOR CO
